010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;

019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
028import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;

030import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;

032/**
033 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
034 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
035 * objects structures. 
036 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
037 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
038 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
039 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
040 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
041 * 
042 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
043 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
044 * 
045 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
046 * 
047 * @author W. Burger
048 * @version 2022/06/21
049 */
050public abstract class Matrix {
051        
052        private Matrix() {}
053        
054        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
055        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
056        
057        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
058        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
059        
060        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
061        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
062        
063        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
064        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
065        
066        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
067        
068        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
069                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
070                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
071                        return A;
072                }
073                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
074                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
075                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
076                }
077                
078                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
079                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
080                                A[r][c] = values[i];
081                                i++;
082                        }
083                }               
084                return A;
085        }
086        
087        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
088                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
089                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
090                        return A;
091                }
092                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
093                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
094                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
095                }       
096                
097                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
098                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
099                                A[r][c] = values[i];
100                                i++;
101                        }
102                }               
103                return A;
104        }
105        
106        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
107                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
108        }
109        
110        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
111                return values;
112        }
113        
114        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
115                return values;
116        }
117        
118        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
119                //return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
120                return new ArrayRealVector(values);
121        }
122        
123        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
124        
125        /**
126         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double} vector of the 
127         * specified length.
128         * @param length the length of the vector
129         * @return a vector with zero values
130         */
131        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
132                if (length < 1)
133                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
134                return new double[length];
135        }
136        
137        /**
138         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
139         * specified size.
140         * @param size the size of the matrix
141         * @return an identity matrix
142         */
143        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
144                if (size < 1)
145                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
146                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
147                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
148                        A[i][i] = 1;
149                }
150                return A;
151        }
152        
153        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
154
155        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
156                return A.length;
157        }
158        
159        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
160                return A[0].length;
161        }
162        
163        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
164                return A.length;
165        }
166        
167        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
168                return A[0].length;
169        }
170        
171        // Extract rows or columns
172        
173        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
174                return A[r].clone();
175        }
176        
177        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
178                final int rows = A.length;
179                double[] col = new double[rows];
180                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
181                        col[r] = A[r][c];
182                }
183                return col;
184        }
185        
186        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
187        
188        /**
189         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
190         * @param A a matrix
191         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
192         */
193        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
194                final int nCols = A[0].length;
195                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
196                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
197                                return false;
198                        }
199                }
200                return true;
201        }
202        
203        /**
204         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
205         * @param A a matrix
206         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
207         */
208        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
209                final int nCols = A[0].length;
210                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
211                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
212                                return false;
213                        }
214                }
215                return true;
216        }
217        
218        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
219         * and columns.
220         * @param A a matrix
221         * @return true iff the matrix is square
222         */
223        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
224                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
225        }
226        
227        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
228         * and columns.
229         * @param A a matrix
230         * @return true iff the matrix is square
231         */
232        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
233                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
234        }
235        
236        /**
237         * TODO: implement!
238         * @param A a matrix
239         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
240         */
241        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
242                return null;
243        }
244        
245        
246        /**
247         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
248         * @param A a square matrix
249         * @return true if the matrix is singular
250         */
251        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
252                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
253                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
254                }               
255                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));         
256        }
257        
258        /**
259         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
260         * @param A a square matrix
261         * @return true if the matrix is singular
262         */
263        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
264                if (!A.isSquare()) {
265                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
266                }               
267                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
268                return !solver.isNonSingular();
269        }
270        
271        
272        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
273        
274        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
275                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
276        }
277        
278        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
279                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
280        }
281        
282        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
283                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
284        }
285        
286        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
287                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
288        }
289        
290        /**
291         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
292         * TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
293         * @param A a square matrix
294         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
295         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
296         */
297        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) {
298                try {
299                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
300                        return true;
301                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
302                return false;
303        }
304        
305        /**
306         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
307         * @param A a square matrix
308         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
309         */
310        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
311                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
312        }
313        
314        /**
315         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
316         * @param a first vector
317         * @param b second vector
318         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
319         */
320        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
321                return a.length == b.length;
322        }
323        
324        /**
325         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
326         * @param a first vector
327         * @param b second vector
328         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
329         */
330        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
331                return a.length == b.length;
332        }
333        
334        /**
335         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
336         * @param A first matrix
337         * @param B second matrix
338         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
339         */
340        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
341                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
342        }
343        
344        /**
345         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
346         * @param A first matrix
347         * @param B second matrix
348         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
349         */
350        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
351                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
352        }
353
354        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
355
356        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
357                return A.clone();
358        }
359        
360        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
361                return A.clone();
362        }
363
364        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
365                final int m = A.length;
366                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
367                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
368                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
369                }
370                return B;
371        }
372        
373        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
374                final int m = A.length;
375                float[][] B = new float[m][];
376                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
377                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
378                }
379                return B;
380        }
381        
382        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
383        
384        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
385                final int m = A.length;
386                final float[] B = new float[m];
387                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
388                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
389                }
390                return B;
391        }
392        
393        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
394                final int m = A.length;
395                final int n = A[0].length;
396                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
397                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
398                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
399                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
400                        }
401                }
402                return B;
403        }
404        
405        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
406                final int m = A.length;
407                final double[] B = new double[m];
408                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
409                        B[i] = A[i];
410                }
411                return B;
412        }
413        
414        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
415                final int m = A.length;
416                final int n = A[0].length;
417                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
418                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
419                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
420                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
421                        }
422                }
423                return B;
424        }

426        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
427        
428        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
429                Arrays.fill(A, val);
430        }
431        
432        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
433                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
434                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
435                }
436        }
437        
438        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
439                Arrays.fill(A, val);
440        }
441        
442        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
443                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
444                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
445                }
446        }
447        
448        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
449        
450        // non-destructive
451        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
452                double[] c = b.clone();
453                addD(a, c);
454                return c;
455        }
456        
457        // destructive, b is modified
458        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
459                if (!sameSize(a, b))
460                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
461                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
462                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
463                }
464        }
465        
466        // non-destructive
467        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
468                float[] c = b.clone();
469                addD(a, c);
470                return c;
471        }
472        
473        // destructive, b is modified
474        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
475                if (!sameSize(a, b))
476                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
477                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
478                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
479                }
480        }
481
482        // non-destructive
483        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
484                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
485                addD(A, C);
486                return C;
487        }
488        
489        // destructive, B is modified
490        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
491                if (!sameSize(A, B))
492                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
493                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
494                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
495                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
496                        }
497                }
498        }
499        
500        // non-destructive
501        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
502                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
503                addD(A, C);
504                return C;
505        }
506        
507        // destructive, B is modified
508        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
509                if (!sameSize(A, B))
510                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
511                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
512                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
513                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
514                        }
515                }
516        }
517        
518        // ------------------------------------------------
519        
520        // non-destructive a - b
521        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
522                if (!sameSize(a, b))
523                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
524                final int n = a.length;
525                double[] c = new double[n];
526                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
527                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
528                }
529                return c;
530        }
531        
532        // non-destructive a - b
533        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
534                if (!sameSize(a, b))
535                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
536                final int n = a.length;
537                float[] c = new float[n];
538                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
539                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
540                }
541                return c;
542        }
543
544        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
545
546        // non-destructive
547        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
548                double[] b = a.clone();
549                multiplyD(s, b);
550                return b;
551        }
552        
553        // destructive
554        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
555                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
556                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
557                }
558        }
559        
560
561        // non-destructive
562        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
563                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
564                multiplyD(s, B);
565                return B;
566        }
567        
568        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
569                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
570                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
571                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
572                        }
573                }
574        }
575        
576        // non-destructive
577        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
578                float[] B = duplicate(A);
579                multiplyD(s, B);
580                return B;
581        }
582        
583        // destructive
584        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
585                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
586                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
587                }
588        }
589
590        // non-destructive
591        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
592                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
593                multiplyD(s, B);
594                return B;
595        }
596        
597        // destructive
598        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
599                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
600                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
601                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
602                        }
603                }
604        }
605        
606        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
607
608        /**
609         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
610         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
611         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
612         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
613         * @return a (row) vector of length n
614         */
615        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
616                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
617                multiplyD(x, A, y);
618                return y;
619        }
620        
621        /**
622         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
623         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
624         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
625         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
626         */
627        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
628                if (x == y) 
629                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
630                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
631                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
632                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
633                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
634                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
635                        double s = 0;
636                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
637                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
638                        }
639                        y[i] = s;
640                }
641        }
642
643        /**
644         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
645         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
646         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
647         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
648         * @return a (column) vector of length m
649         */
650        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
651                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
652                multiplyD(A, x, y);
653                return y;
654        }
655        
656        /**
657         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
658         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
659         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
660         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
661         */
662        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
663                if (x == y) 
664                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
665                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
666                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
667                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
668                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
669                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
670                        double s = 0;
671                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
672                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
673                        }
674                        y[i] = s;
675                }
676        }
677        
678        /**
679         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
680         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
681         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
682         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
683         * @return a (column) vector of length m
684         */
685        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
686                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
687                multiplyD(A, x, y);
688                return y;
689        }
690        
691        /**
692         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
693         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
694         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
695         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
696         */
697        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
698                if (x == y) 
699                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
700                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
701                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
702                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
703                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
704                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
705                        double s = 0;
706                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
707                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
708                        }
709                        y[i] = (float) s;
710                }
711        }
712        
713
714        
715        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
716        
717        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
718        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
719                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
720                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
721                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(m, q);
722                multiplyD(A, B, C);
723                return C;
724        }
725        
726        // A * B -> C (destructive)
727        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
728                if (A == C || B == C) 
729                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
730                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
731                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
732                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
733                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
734                if (nA != mB)
735                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
736                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
737                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
738                                double s = 0;
739                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
740                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
741                                }
742                                C[i][j] = s;
743                        }
744                }
745        }
746        
747        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
748        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
749                // TODO: also check nA = mB
750                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
751                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
752                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
753                multiplyD(A, B, C);
754                return C;
755        }
756
757        // A * B -> C (destructive)
758        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
759                if (A == C || B == C) 
760                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
761                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
762                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
763                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
764                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
765                if (nA != mB)
766                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
767                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
768                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
769                                float s = 0;
770                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
771                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
772                                }
773                                C[i][j] = s;
774                        }
775                }
776        }
777        
778        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
779        
780        /**
781         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
782         * which must have the same length.
783         * @param x first vector
784         * @param y second vector
785         * @return the dot product
786         */
787        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
788                if (!sameSize(x, y))
789                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
790                double sum = 0;
791                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
792                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
793                }
794                return sum;
795        }
796        
797        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
798        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
799        /**
800         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
801         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
802         * m is the length of the second vector.
803         * @param x first vector (of length m)
804         * @param y second vector (of length n)
805         * @return the outer product (matrix)
806         */
807        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
808                final int m = x.length;
809                final int n = y.length;
810                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
811                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
812                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
813                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
814                        }
815                }
816                return M;
817        }
818
819        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
820
821        /**
822         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
823         * @param x a vector
824         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
825         */
826        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
827                double sum = 0;
828                for (double val : x) {
829                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
830                }
831                return sum;
832        }
833
834        /**
835         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
836         * @param x a vector
837         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
838         */
839        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
840                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
841        }
842
843        /**
844         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
845         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
846         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
847         * @param x a vector
848         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
849         */
850        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
851                double sum = 0;
852                for (double val : x) {
853                        sum = sum + (val * val);
854                }
855                return sum;
856        }
857        
858        /**
859         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
860         * @param x a vector
861         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
862         */
863        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
864                double sum = 0;
865                for (double val : x) {
866                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
867                }
868                return (float) sum;
869        }
870
871        /**
872         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
873         * @param x a vector
874         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
875         */
876        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
877                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
878        }
879
880        /**
881         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
882         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
883         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
884         * @param x a vector
885         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
886         */
887        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
888                double sum = 0;
889                for (double val : x) {
890                        sum = sum + (val * val);
891                }
892                return (float) sum;
893        }
894        
895        // Normalize vectors
896        
897        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
898                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
899                normalizeD(xx);
900                return xx;
901        }
902        
903        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
904                multiplyD(1.0 / normL2(x), x);
905        }
906        
907        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
908        
909        /** 
910         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
911         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
912         * number of elements.
913         * @param x first vector
914         * @param y second vector
915         * @return the distance
916         */
917        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
918                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
919        }
920        
921        /** 
922         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
923         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
924         * number of elements.
925         * @param x first vector
926         * @param y second vector
927         * @return the squared distance
928         */
929        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
930                double sum = 0;
931                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
932                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
933                }
934                return sum;
935        }
936        
937        /** 
938         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
939         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
940         * number of elements.
941         * @param x first vector
942         * @param y second vector
943         * @return the distance
944         */
945        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
946                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
947        }
948        
949        /** 
950         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
951         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
952         * number of elements.
953         * @param x first vector
954         * @param y second vector
955         * @return the squared distance
956         */
957        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
958                double sum = 0;
959                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
960                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
961                }
962                return (float) sum;
963        }
964        
965        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
966        
967        /**
968         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
969         * @param A a matrix
970         * @return the norm of the matrix
971         */
972        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
973                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
974                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
975                double s = 0;
976                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
977                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
978                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
979                        }
980                }
981                return Math.sqrt(s);
982        }
983
984        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
985
986        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
987                double sum = 0;
988                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
989                        sum = sum + x[i];
990                }
991                return sum;
992        }
993        
994        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
995                double sum = 0;
996                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
997                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
998                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
999                        }
1000                }
1001                return sum;
1002        }
1003        
1004        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
1005                double sum = 0;
1006                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1007                        sum = sum + x[i];
1008                }
1009                return (float) sum;
1010        }
1011        
1012        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1013                double sum = 0;
1014                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1015                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1016                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1017                        }
1018                }
1019                return sum;
1020        }

1026         * @param A a matrix
1027         * @param row the row index
1028         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1029         */
1030        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1031                return sum(A[row]);
1032        }

1035         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1036         * @param A a matrix
1037         * @param row the row index
1038         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1039         */
1040        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1041                return sum(A[row]);
1042        }

1044
1045        /**
1046         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1047         * @param A a matrix
1048         * @param col the column index
1049         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1050         */
1051        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1052                double sum = 0;
1053                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1054                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1055                }
1056                return sum;
1057        }
1058        
1059        /**
1060         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1061         * @param A a matrix
1062         * @param col the column index
1063         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1064         */
1065        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1066                double sum = 0;
1067                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1068                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1069                }
1070                return (float) sum;
1071        }
1072        
1073        /**
1074         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1075         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1076         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1077         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1078         */
1079        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1080                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1081                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1082                        double sum = 0;
1083                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1084                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1085                        }
1086                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1087                }
1088                return sumVec;
1089        }
1090        
1091        /**
1092         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1093         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1094         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1095         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1096         */
1097        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1098                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1099                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1100                        double sum = 0;
1101                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1102                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1103                        }
1104                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1105                }
1106                return sumVec;
1107        }
1108        
1109        /**
1110         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1111         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1112         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1113         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1114         */
1115        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1116                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1117                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1118                        double sum = 0;
1119                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1120                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1121                        }
1122                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1123                }
1124                return sumVec;
1125        }
1126        
1127        /**
1128         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1129         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1130         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1131         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1132         */
1133        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {

1135                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {

1137                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1138                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1139                        }
1140                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1141                }
1142                return sumVec;
1143        }
1144        
1145        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1146        
1147        // TODO:  testing,  add float version
1148        /**
1149         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1150         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1151         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1152         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1153         * 
1154         * @param x a vector
1155         * @return the index of the smallest value
1156         */
1157        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1158                if (x.length == 0)
1159                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1160                double minval = x[0];
1161                int minidx = 0;
1162                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1163                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1164                                minval = x[i];
1165                                minidx = i;
1166                        }
1167                }
1168                return minidx;
1169        }
1170        
1171        // TODO: testing, add float version
1172        /**
1173         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1174         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1175         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1176         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1177         * 
1178         * @param x a vector
1179         * @return the index of the largest value
1180         */
1181        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1182                if (x.length == 0)
1183                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1184                double maxval = x[0];
1185                int maxidx = 0;
1186                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1187                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1188                                maxval = x[i];
1189                                maxidx = i;
1190                        }
1191                }
1192                return maxidx;
1193        }
1194        
1195        
1196        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1197                if (x.length == 0)
1198                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1199                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1200                for (float val : x) {
1201                        if (val < minval) {
1202                                minval = val;
1203                        }
1204                }
1205                return minval;
1206        }
1207        
1208        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1209                if (x.length == 0)
1210                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1211                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1212                for (double val : x) {
1213                        if (val < minval) {
1214                                minval = val;
1215                        }
1216                }
1217                return minval;
1218        }

1221        
1222        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1223                if (x.length == 0)
1224                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1225                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1226                for (float val : x) {
1227                        if (val > maxval) {
1228                                maxval = val;
1229                        }
1230                }
1231                return maxval;
1232        }
1233        
1234        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1235                if (x.length == 0)
1236                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1237                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1238                for (double val : x) {
1239                        if (val > maxval) {
1240                                maxval = val;
1241                        }
1242                }
1243                return maxval;
1244        }
1245        
1246        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1247                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1248                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1249                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1250                                if (val > maxval) {
1251                                        maxval = val;
1252                                }
1253                        }
1254                }
1255                return maxval;
1256        }
1257        
1258        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1259                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1260                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1261                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1262                                if (val > maxval) {
1263                                        maxval = val;
1264                                }
1265                        }
1266                }
1267                return maxval;

1269        
1270        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1271        
1272        /**
1273         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1274         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1275         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1276         */
1277        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1278                int n = 0;
1279                for (float[] x : xs) {
1280                        n = n + x.length;
1281                }
1282                float[] va = new float[n];
1283                int j = 0;
1284                for (float[] x : xs) {
1285                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1286                                va[j] = x[i];
1287                                j++;
1288                        }
1289                }               
1290                return va;
1291        }
1292
1293        /**
1294         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1295         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1296         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1297         */
1298        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1299                int n = 0;
1300                for (double[] x : xs) {
1301                        n = n + x.length;
1302                }
1303                double[] va = new double[n];    
1304                int j = 0;
1305                for (double[] x : xs) {
1306                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1307                                va[j] = x[i];
1308                                j++;
1309                        }
1310                }               
1311                return va;
1312        }
1313        
1314        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1315        
1316        /**
1317         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1318         * which must have the same length.
1319         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1320         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1321         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1322         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1323         * @return the interpolated vector
1324         */
1325        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1326                float[] c = new float[a.length];
1327                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1328                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1329                }
1330                return c;
1331        }
1332        
1333        /**
1334         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1335         * which must have the same length.
1336         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1337         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1338         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1339         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1340         * @return the interpolated vector
1341         */
1342        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1343                double[] c = new double[a.length];
1344                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1345                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1346                }
1347                return c;
1348        }
1349        
1350        
1351        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1352        
1353        /**
1354         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1355         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1356         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
1357         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1358         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1359         */
1360        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1361                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1362                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1363                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1364                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1365                }
1366                return xh;
1367        }
1368        
1369        /**
1370         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1371         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1372         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
1373         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1374         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1375         */
1376        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1377                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1378                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1379                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1380                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1381                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1382                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1383                }
1384                return xc;
1385        }
1386        
1387        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1388        
1389        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1390                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1391                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1392                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1393        }
1394        
1395        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1396                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1397                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1398                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1399        }
1400        
1401        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1402                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1403                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1404                return
1405                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1406                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1407                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1408                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1409                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1410                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1411        }
1412
1413        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1414                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1415                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1416                return 
1417                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1418                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1419                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1420                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1421                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1422                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1423        }
1424        
1425        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1426                if (!A.isSquare())
1427                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1428                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
1429        }
1430        
1431        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1432                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
1433        }
1434        
1435        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1436        
1437        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1438                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1439                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1440                if (m != n) 
1441                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1442                double s = 0;
1443                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1444                                s = s + A[i][i];
1445                }
1446                return s;
1447        }
1448        
1449        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1450        
1451        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1452                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1453                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1454                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1455                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1456                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1457                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1458                        }
1459                }
1460                return At;
1461        }
1462        
1463        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1464                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1465                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1466                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1467                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1468                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1469                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1470                        }
1471                }
1472                return At;
1473        }
1474        
1475        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
1476        
1477        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
1478                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1479                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1480                                return false;
1481                        }
1482                }
1483                return true;
1484        }
1485        
1486        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
1487                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
1488        }
1489        
1490        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
1491                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1492                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1493                                return false;
1494                        }
1495                }
1496                return true;
1497        }
1498        
1499        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
1500                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
1501        }
1502        
1503        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
1504        
1505        public static double[] sort(double[] x) {
1506                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
1507                Arrays.sort(y);
1508                return y;
1509        }
1510        
1511        public static float[] sort(float[] x) {
1512                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
1513                Arrays.sort(y);
1514                return y;
1515        }
1516        
1517        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
1518        
1519        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
1520                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
1521                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
1522                                return false;
1523                        }
1524                }
1525                return true;
1526        }
1527        
1528        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
1529                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
1530        }
1531        
1532        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1533        
1534        /**
1535         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1536         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1537         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1538         * @param A a square matrix
1539         * @return the inverse matrix
1540         */
1541        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1542                if (!isSquare(A))
1543                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1544                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1545                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1546        }
1547        
1548        /**
1549         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1550         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1551         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1552         * @param A a square matrix
1553         * @return the inverse matrix
1554         */
1555        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1556                if (!isSquare(A))
1557                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1558                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1559                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1560        }
1561
1562        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1563        
1564        /**
1565         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1566         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1567         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1568         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1569         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
1570         * 
1571         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1572         * @param b a vector of length n
1573         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1574         */
1575        
1576        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1577                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
1578                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
1579                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1580                }
1581                if (x == null) {
1582                        return null;
1583                }
1584                else {
1585                        return x.toArray();
1586                }
1587        }
1588        
1589        /**
1590         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1591         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1592         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1593         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1594         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library
1595         * (with singularity threshold set to zero).
1596         * 
1597         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1598         * @param b a vector of length n
1599         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1600         */
1601        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
1602                if (!A.isSquare()) {
1603                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1604                }
1605                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
1606                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1607                }
1608                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
1609                RealVector x = null;
1610                try {
1611                        x = solver.solve(b);
1612                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1613                return x;
1614        }
1615        
1616        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1617        
1618        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1619                if (x == null) {
1620                        return String.valueOf(x);
1621                }
1622                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1623                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1624                printToStream(x, strm);
1625                return bas.toString();
1626        }
1627        
1628        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1629                if (x == null) {
1630                        return String.valueOf(x);
1631                }
1632                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1633                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1634                printToStream(x, strm);
1635                return bas.toString();
1636        }
1637        
1638        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1639                if (A == null) {
1640                        return String.valueOf(A);
1641                }
1642                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1643                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1644                printToStream(A, strm);
1645                return bas.toString();
1646        }
1647        
1648        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1649                if (A == null) {
1650                        return String.valueOf(A);
1651                }
1652                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1653                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1654                printToStream(A, strm);
1655                return bas.toString();
1656        }
1657        
1658        public static String toString(RealVector x) {
1659                if (x == null) {
1660                        return String.valueOf(x);
1661                }
1662                else {
1663                        return toString(x.toArray());
1664                }
1665        }
1666        
1667        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
1668                if (A == null) {
1669                        return String.valueOf(A);
1670                }
1671                else {
1672                        return toString(A.getData());
1673                }
1674        }
1675        
1676        // --------------------
1677        
1678        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1679                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1680                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1681                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1682                        if (i > 0)
1683                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1684                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1685                }
1686                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1687                strm.flush();
1688        }
1689        
1690        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1691                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1692                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1693                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1694                        if (i == 0)
1695                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1696                        else
1697                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1698                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1699                                if (j == 0) 
1700                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1701                                else
1702                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1703                        }
1704                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1705                }
1706                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1707                strm.flush();
1708        }
1709        
1710        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1711                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1712                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1713                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1714                        if (i > 0)
1715                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1716                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1717                }
1718                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1719                strm.flush();
1720        }
1721        
1722        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1723                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1724                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1725                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1726                        if (i == 0)
1727                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1728                        else
1729                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1730                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1731                                if (j == 0) 
1732                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1733                                else
1734                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1735                        }
1736                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1737                }
1738                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1739                strm.flush();
1740        }
1741
1742        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
1743        
1744        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1745                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1746                
1747                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1748                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1749                }
1750        }
1751        
1752        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1753                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1754                
1755                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1756                        super("square matrix expected");
1757                }
1758        }
1759        
1760        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1761                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1762                
1763                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1764                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1765                }
1766        }
1767        
1768        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1769                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1770                
1771                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1772                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1773                }
1774        }
1775        
1776        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1777        
1778        public static void main(String[] args) {
1779                double s = Double.NaN;
1780                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
1781                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
1782                System.out.println((double[]) null);
1783                
1784                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
1785                                1,2,3,4,
1786                                5,6,7,8,
1787                                9,10,11,12,
1788                                13,14,15,16,
1789                                17,18,19,20);
1790                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
1791                
1792                RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
1793                System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
1794
1795        }
